description: Computes anomalies based on normals for a specific temporal frequency.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A data cube. The datacube must contain exactly one temporal dimension.

parameters.name: normals
parameters.description: A data cube with normals, e.g. daily, monthly or yearly values from ``climatological_normal()``. Must contain exactly one temporal dimension with the labels set to numerical days of year, month of year week of year or years respectively.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Specifies the time intervals available in the `normals` data cube. The following pre-defined frequencies are supported with their expected dimension labels in the normals data cube:

* `hourly`: Hour of the day. Dimension labels: `0` - `23`
* `daily`: Day of the year. Dimension labels: `1` - `365`
* `weekly`: Week of the year. Dimension labels: `1` - `52`
* `monthly`: Month of the year. Dimension labels: `1` - `12`
* `yearly`: Number of the year. Dimension labels are the four-digit year numbers.
* `single_period` / `climatology_period`: A single period, e.g. the climatology period. A single dimension label with any name is expected.
* `seasons`: Refers to three month periods of the calendar seasons (winter, spring, summer, autumn). Dimension labels: `djf` (December - February), `mam` (March - May), `jja` (June - August), `son` (September - November).
* `tropical_seasons`: Refers to the 6 month periods of the tropical seasons (dry, wet). Dimension labels: `ndjfma` (November - April), `mjjaso` (May - October).

returns.description: A data cube. The cardinality, resolution and the number of dimensions are the same as for the original data cube.
